summary: This bill, the "National Capital Planning Commission District of Columbia Home Rule Act," aims to remove the National Capital Planning Commission's authority over District of Columbia-owned property. It amends Title 40 of the United States Code, specifically Section 8124 and Section 8722, regarding the Commission's recommendations for property transfers and approval of proposed developments. It also strikes Section 8734 related to the Commission's land sales authority, granting more autonomy to the District. The amendments take effect upon enactment of the Act.
